woah, woah, woah. hold up. When God created us, He gave us free will, to live our life how we will. However, just because He created us doesnt mean He likes the choices we make. He saw this coming, yes, but if He would have created us without being able to choose what we did in our lives we would only be robots, and that would negate the point of salvation. So, whether you agree with homosexuality or not, dont blame God. (Isaiah 3:9 - NIV)

Honestly, unless you have personally communicated with God, and he told you that he doesn't approve of it, then you do not know what he thinks. Remember that even though you say that the Bible is God's word, it was still written by humans. Humans make mistakes.

So Jacob if "he" saw this coming.....then "he" purposely set others up to fail? :( Can I ask a question I rarely see someone ask?...because your statement concerns me...."but if He would have created us without being able to choose what we did in our lives we would only be robots, and that would negate the point of salvation. So, whether you agree with homosexuality or not, don't blame God." So then God created us to marvel in his glory and submit to his will for the ultimate prize of going to Heaven? He didn't make us robots so that way we could beg him for salvation? O.O;; This doesn't sound like a loving God...making your people beg for mercy?...Marie Antoinette tried this and she was beheaded :(
Either god created free will or god has a divine plan.  Y'all need up to make up your mind with your conflicting ideology.

Sherrie, once you reach that time in your life, and I am praying that you will, that you realize that there is litteraly no other option. However, it is not a begging for His mercy. We are not bowing at His gates desperately trying to submit to rules and standards so that He may or may not apply His grace. No, the Bible says "Whosoever will may come." Think of it like this. Your drowning in a sea, and God throws you a rope. He doesnt  make you take it, or force you to beg. It is a choice to accept His gift of grace. And once you do, it isnt a "submitting to His will" its a joyous day by day decision to live for His honour and glory. I hope and pray that one day you will experience this for yourself.
And Jesus thought it was so important as to say NOTHING on the subject....

I understand your perspective Jacob...but it still sounds rather unfavoring to me. Not the grace part but the methods to obtain grace. here's what concerns me. "God" creates beings...gives them free will...yet knows their future....continues on anyway knowing which creations will go to "hell".So a person can live their entire life in good graces...a caring and loving soul...devoting his or her life to the progress and beauty of others...but be refused into heaven because of a sexual preference? They were born the way they are...in so...they were purposely given life to be sinful? I do not believe an all loving God would have selective love. I know how painful it is for me to carry around hate for a day...to miss an entire day being bitter and spiteful. If "God" disagreed tot his ...why not fix it now? :s People who are gay suffer...not all of them but many of them do. Why condemn someone to wake up everyday and question their existence...beg God to change them yet they remain who they ARE? Maybe hate is a human condition..and not a divine one? I don't know...All I mean to say is maybe we shouldn't speak for a God who isn't speaking for his/herself. I am not saying God does or doesn't exist...I wouldn't know...all I mean to imply is that maybe this isn't as big of a concern to "God" as it is to some members of the human race. I am not trying to be mean...this is just my perspective :)
